barchart.semantic: Our barchart has inputs for bars and size. Bars either a date, number or string, defining the X-axis. Size is a number defining the Y-axis, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

geomap.semantic: Our geomap has inputs for country and size. Country is a string representation of a country. Size is a representation of the value, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

linechart.semantic: Our linechart has inputs for X Axis, Y Axis and Lines. X Axis and Y Axis are either a number or date, defining the X and Y axis. Lines is a number, date or string, defining the lines on the chart by for example grouping the data points in a category.

sankey.semantic: Our sankey has inputs for steps and size. Steps is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the steps in the sankey. Size is a number defining the size of the steps, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.

treemap.semantic: Our treemap has inputs for hierarchy and size. Hierarchy is an ordered list of: a number, date or string, defining the blocks in the treemap. Size is a number defining the size of the hierarchy blocks, and can be the average, count, count unique, max, min, sum, median, csv or csv unique.
